comments.content: You almost got me there. The reason it's A is because of the "continuous usage". In terms of most cost effective, you would have to pair the Spot Instance with other services like auto scaling, EMR, etc which would increase cost. Continuous to me means no down time; Spot instances aren't as reliable on their own. Reserved Instances for the W

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Its B. It says the MOST cost effective and that is Spot instance. It doesnt say it needs to run without downtime. That 1 year is a trick in the question.
why not spot instances? cheaper than RI?

questions.question_text:
A company plans to migrate its application to AWS and run the application on Amazon EC2 instances. The application will have continuous usage for 1 year.

Which EC2 instance purchasing option will meet these requirements MOST cost-effectively?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A. The company

According to the AWS shared responsibility model, the customer is responsible for the security of data in transit between AWS services (such as an Amazon S3 bucket) and their on-premises applications. This includes implementing encryption, secure transfer protocols (e.g., HTTPS or SFTP), and network configurations to ensure data security.

Networking and traffic protection are a customer responsibility.
And of course Identity and Access Management which are needed when accessing an S3 bucket

Selected Answer: A
Networking and traffic protection are a customer responsibility. 
And of course Identity and Access Management which are needed when accessing an S3 bucket.

Selected Answer: A
The Customer..
AWS is responsible for the security "of" the cloud infrastructure
The customer is responsible for the security "in" the cloud.

Selected Answer: A
I bet to be A since AWS can offer several services to protect data but it's up to the customer to apply the security controls needed to protect their own data

Selected Answer: A
Customer is to responsible to protect their own data
https://aws.amazon.com/compliance/shared-responsibility-model/
A. I think the company Should make sure they have proper security in place. AWS cannot be hold accountable.

Selected Answer: B
Data transfer from S3 to on-prem is chargable and also AWS sevirces to be used
Shouldn't it be B?

questions.question_text: Which pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework refers to the ability of a system to recover from infrastructure or service disruptions and dynamically acquire computing resources to meet demand?

A company wants to identify Amazon S3 buckets that are shared with another AWS account.

Which AWS service or feature will meet these requirements?

discussion.content:
D is correct
"IAM Access Analyzer:
• Find out which resources are shared
externally
• S3 Buckets
• IAM Roles
• KMS Keys
• Lambda Functions and Layers
• SQS queues
• Secrets Manager Secrets"
 upvoted 1

Selected Answer: D
D. IAM Access Analyzer

D. IAM Access Analyzer

IAM Access Analyzer helps you identify resources in your AWS account, such as S3 buckets, that are shared with external principals (including other AWS accounts). It continuously monitors resource policies for public and cross-account access to identify any unintended or risky configurations.

Selected Answer: D
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/what-is-access-analyzer.html
IAM Access Analyzer external access analyzers help identify resources in your organization and accounts that are shared with an external entity.

Selected Answer: C
C. Amazon QuickSight
Amazon QuickSight is a business intelligence (BI) service that enables users to create interactive dashboards and visualizations. It integrates with AWS data sources (e.g., Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift) and supports machine learning (ML) insights like anomaly detection and forecasting. These features allow users to gain deeper insights into their data and make data-driven decisions.
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/quicksight/

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/quicksight/

Selected Answer: C
Amazon QuickSight is the AWS service that gives users the ability to create interactive business intelligence (BI) dashboards that can include machine learning insights. It allows you to connect and visualize data from various sources, perform exploratory analysis and share information collaboratively in the form of reports and dashboards.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct
